attributes.action: ban the practice of docking tails of dogs, even and especially if they have been traditionally docked, and to end all similar forms of mutilation to dogs
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Some breeds traditionally have had their tails docked while they are young.  Supporters claim that it isn't painful, and necessary for the breed.  However, it is clearly painful to the puppy, and is purely a cosmetic exercise for the vanity of pwners.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "ban the practice of docking tails of dogs, even and especially if they have been traditionally docked, and to end all similar forms of mutilation to dogs."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page12187.asp

Prime Minister's Office
